snippet: Iraq may see the possibility of significant aid from Iran as a means of pressuring the United States to come to Iraq’s defense with aid of its own.
abstract: American officials say Gen Qassim Suleimani, commander of Iran's paramilitary Quds Force, flew to Iraq with dozens of his officers to advise country's leadership about how to blunt advance of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria forces; contact suggests that Iraqis see possibility of significant aid from Iran as means of pressuring United States to come to Iraq's defense with aid of its own.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT, MARK MAZZETTI and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Rod Norland contributed reporting from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Iraq may see the possibility of significant aid from Iran as a means of pressuring the United States to come to Iraq’s defense with aid of its own.

headline.main: Beleaguered Iraqis Court Iranian Mastermind of the Shiites Who Fought the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Beleaguered Iraqis Court Iranian Mastermind of the Shiites Who Fought the U.S.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
